title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Licence Fee)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Private Security (Licence Fee) 

(Amendment) Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited private security (licence fee) (amendment) regulation 2024

title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 8th May, 2024.
text_raw: 2. These Regulations come into operation on the 8th May, 2024.

title: (No. 23 of 2011)) of the Private Security Services Act 2004 (No. 12 of 2004),
heading: 3. The Private Security (Licence Fee) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 362 of
text_raw:
3. The Private Security (Licence Fee) Regulations 2015 (S.I. No. 362 of 

2015) are amended by substituting the following for Regulation 4 – 

“4. Subject to Regulation 5, the fees payable to the Authority in respect of 
an application for a category of licence shall be determined by reference to the 
following table:- 

Category of Licence 

Licence Fee 

door supervisor 

enforcement guard 

private investigator 

provider of protected forms of transport (cash-intransit) 

security guard (guarding) 

€150 

€90 

€90 

€150 

€90” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 17th May, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Justice consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

[206] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Justice, 

8 May, 2024. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 
Minister for Justice. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

8 May, 2024. 

JILLIAN VAN TURNHOUT, 

Chairperson. 

PAUL SCALLAN, 
Chief Executive. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [206]
